pros: Great company to work for, good pay and excellent work environment. Management is working on strategic changes to be competitive as new players are trying to cut into the commercial space.
cons: Workforce alignment is taking too long and too much of churn, they need to bring it to a closure soon to have stability and focus on productivity improvements.

job_title: 737 Engineering Manager Level K in Renton, WA
pros: You have the opportunity to make your work life how you want it to be.  It is such a large company, that if you don't like one job, you can proactively find a different one.  You work on cutting edge, high-impact projects. Benefits and 401k are fantastic too.

review_title: Great for retirement, terrible for career development

pros: Big, well known company with great benefits, like stock options and medical. Pay is low to middle of the scale.

review_title: Depends on who you work for and when

cons: Like any other large company they have been reducing benefits each year, by either scaling back on employee benefits or raising the cost to the employee.

pros: Good benefits and opportunity to travel the world. Good technology to get educated on if you can fall in the right group.
cons: Bureaucracy is a huge con with Boeing, also not alot of budget for promotion. Not alot of reward for hard work.

pros: Strong vision from leadership on what, how and why for the Industrial Engineering Team. The job allowed me a lot of autonomy; I could dig in anywhere I saw a need for improvement. If I was persuasive, the project moved forward.
cons: I liked my little corner of Boeing. Peers in other areas worried about stagnation and overwork.

job_title: Business and Planning Analyst II in Renton, WA
pros: Many different opportunities both within and external to your field of specialization
cons: The company is so large and work is so segregated, employees end up doing such a specialized piece of the total that it is hard to maintain a sense of ownership. Segmentation of work statement is turning employees into robots.

review_title: Environmental, Health, and Safety Specialist II
pros: Great team, great manager, very good benefits package. Love the mission each day presents, never becomes a monotonous grind. Performance reflects pay.
cons: Not sure how long my team will stay. Current position is launching pad into bigger & better positions. Very high turnover.

pros: Compensation was good. Flexible hours and being able to work from home was great. Extended holiday paid time off, like approx. two weeks over Christmas and New Years.
cons: Management is a joke. Too many huge egos in one place. The location is horrible, one of the highest crime rates and poverty in St. Louis, not to mention the closest highways are the worst for traffic no matter which direction you're coming from.

pros: Great company to work for. Excellent benefits. Management supports and empowers its people. People are [generally] happy and engaged on the job. It feels like you're making a difference. Room for technical growth.
cons: Not so much room for upward growth into management / exec track. Although well qualified, I seem to hit the ceiling a lot.

job_title: Senior Manager Business Development in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Boeing provides opportunities across many disciplines, good benefits package, continuing education opportunities and wellness programs
cons: Hierarchial organization structure which awards time in position is still prevalent throughout the company

pros: Good pay and benefits.  Very good internal web site with good resources and tools.
cons: Very poor leadership.  Shifts problem individuals around instead of dealing with the problem.  Poor leadership impacts morale.

review_title: Have worked at numerous aviation companies, but Boeing has best benefits and people.
pros: Great career options and numerous pathways for aviation/space buffs. Can learn from the depth of expertise from colleagues and are encouraged to innovate.
cons: Sometimes policies and procedures slow down the speed of getting things done, but in general management works with you to implement improvements.

pros: Large company, so benefits such as healthcare and 401k are great and there are plenty of opportunities for advancement, especially if you are willing to move.
cons: Yearly raises, like most companies, will not exceed 3%, so unless you can move up a level or take another position, it will take a while to increase your salary.

pros: Great work-life balance, great benefits, amazing 401k matching, the company paisfor education, interesting projects, many opportunities to grow professionally, many smart people who can assist you if you get stuck or want to learn new things
cons: Salary is not comparative in comparison to companies in this area, a lot of bureaucracy.

review_title: Boeing is a good company, but not great.
job_title: Business Process Analyst in Renton, WA
pros: Benefits and student tuition program are great!  The people are great!
cons: Pay is below average for like size companies.  Every year they seem to be taking something new away from employees to reduce cost.

review_title: Limited number of career opportunities to advance.
pros: Aerospace leader and develops great products that are well recognized.  Entry level hiring opportunities in the near future due to half of work force is eligible to retire
cons: A lot of downsizing, layoffs and geographic work placement occurring within company.  Very limited number of career opportunities to advance.

pros: Boeing has decent benefits and the likehood of getting a raise every year. Many departments are willing to help your career growth.
cons: There is quite a bit of red tape to get anything accomplished. While they like to see you grow sometimes it is hard to move up the latter if you are support staff in corporate.

pros: The schooling, training and medical benefits are the best perk. Occasionally there are other incentives (movie tickets, points, etc). There is potential for advancement.
cons: Advancement is entirely dependent upon manager and location. Even if you have all your lights on, a manager can hold you to your job code.

job_title: Senior Equipment Rigger in El Segundo, CA
pros:
Great Place to work,
Lots of travel to launch sites around the world,
Great Pay and benefits,
Being a part of something big
cons:
Difficult to get merit based pay increases,
Encumbered by " numbers" process when it comes to lay offs,

review_title: Great opportunities, if you can stick with it
pros: Great opportunities, paid education and lots of development opportunities, easy to move into different career paths and can be successful on a professional or manager career path
cons: lots of management challenges, very bureaucratic, highly complex processes and policies, doesn't train managers well, significant cultural challenges and lack of accountability

review_title: Great job, management won't deal with personnel issues
job_title: Supply Chain Specialist Level II in Charleston, SC
pros: Great job, learn new skills all the time, great sense of accomplishment, sense of accomplishment in supporting the US military.
cons: Small office with personnel problems and management won't deal with problems.  Small office so not much chance for promotion.

review_title: Would not recommend for those who want to start a career
pros: 401k match is good compared to other companies
cons:
- Extremely low pay compared to the location of the company (Seattle area)
-no stock bonus for non-management employees
- very low annual bonus ( around 5% of salary)
- unmotivated people/coworkers
- VERY slow pace
- surrounded by people who aren't passionate about the company/work but just there to take the paycheck
- average age group of employees in the late 40's to 50's
- not the favorable culture for people in their 20s

review_title: Good colleagues, mix bag of management
pros: Good benefits, decent salary,  cool technology on new projects, engaging if you want more, opportunities to take on bigger projects if you are motivated.
cons: Old school way of working. To much focus on unrealistic schedules instead of excellence in engineering.  Politics (of course).

job_title: Embedded Software Engineer in Houston, TX
pros: Prestige.  Global reach and multiple job opportunities within the Company.  It supports and we can actually participate in the advancement of humanity into the Last Frontier: Space.
cons: I cannot think of any downsides just at the moment of which I feel strongly about.

review_title: Very poor management place to wok for...
job_title: Real-time Software Engineer P6 in Huntington Beach, CA
pros:
Very good health benefits
Good Salary
Better 401k matching and retirement plan compares with Northrop, Raytheon, etc...
cons: Poor management that only takes care of themselves, blaming on others for the bad jobs. Management with old-boy network, no real communication and teamwork.

review_title: Needs a shift in performance evaluation and recognition of high potential employees
pros: Benefits, and the opportunity to work with good people
cons: performance compensation and promotion structure is rigid without the flexibility to identify high potentials and reward for work above and beyond expectations.

review_title: Needs a shift in performance evaluation and recognition of high potential employees
pros: Benefits, and the opportunity to work with good people
cons: performance compensation and promotion structure is rigid without the flexibility to identify high potentials and reward for work above and beyond expectations.

pros: Good opportunity to explore different jobs while staying with the same company
cons: There is a lot of bureaucracy, as can be expected with any large company

review_title: Boeing encourages a very healthy work environment, providing room to grow professionally while balancing personal life.
job_title: Systems Integration Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
healthy work environment
management is open to two way communication
opportunities for professional growth
good balance of work with personal life
cons:
layoffs have been a harsh reality in today's economy
large company, sometimes communication is not as frequent or as informative as I would hope

review_title: Great place to work but promotion process is frustrating
job_title: Software Engineer III in Dallas, TX
pros: Fantastic benefits, very interesting work
cons: Promotion and raise process is frustrating. Your job performance is only 25% of what goes into determining your yearly evaluation for a raise.

review_title: Great place for improvement towards management.
pros: The company offers growth towards management is always a good pro of this company. Stock summaries as well are in good standing.
cons: Long hours can sometimes come about from here as well as relocation if you are not subject to change. Lay offs have happened several times throughout my time here.

review_title: Boeing is going down the tubes.
pros: Excellent benefit and wage package.
cons: Clueless management.  Countless poor decisions that cost time and money in the long run in which the working engineer ends up taking the brunt of the blame.  Many managers that needed to be fired.

pros:
Great benefits
Free tuition
Yearly bonuses
75% matching up to 8% salary 401K
You don't have to do much to get paid well
cons:
-Seattle area is expensive and has bad traffic
-Slow career growth
-political promotions and employee rankings
-you get penalized for trying too hard
besides the pay it's not worth working here.

pros: Very courteous and treat their employees with respect and the benefits are second to none. their compensation is better than the industry average
cons: communication is sometimes an issue  they have limited scope for designated work definition and can use a more open approach to work hours

review_title: Only worth it for the pay.
pros:
Good pay
Insurance
Payed vacation
Payed holidays
Payed sick leave
cons:
-Extremely lazy co-workers, they will do as little as possible.
-The laziest seem to get rewarded.
-If you work hard, you are not noticed. Managers just give you more and more work to do and then yell at you when you can't finish everything.
-You need to kiss butt to get anywhere.
-Co-workers love to gossip and are not afraid to stab other co-workers in the back.

review_title: Decent benefits - a lot of bureaucracy
pros: Great opportunity for work life balance as 9-5 Monday-Friday are the expectation and you aren't required to go above and beyond that.
cons: Lack of personal accountability within the company leads to frustrating productivity for those who are high achievers as they become frustrated with those not being held accountable

review_title: Work life balance with emphasis on life
pros: Decent paycheck with virtually no expectation of placing work before outside life
cons: Inverse of the pro, not a place to work if you want to make above-average money

pros: Good benefits, but getting worse.  Many different opportunities at Boeing.  Many different locations.
cons: Everyone treated like a factory worker.  Management sometimes inconsistent.  Hard to figure which direction they want to go.  Everyone virtual then everyone at office, then everyone needs to move.

pros: Good diversity of experiences available, with a wide-range of resources to take advantage of.
cons: Must be able to navigate and deal with bureaucracy, including tracking time spent on tasks to the nearest tenth of an hour and participating in annual ethics training expounding on the detriments of using the company printer for personal use.

pros: Great environment, great people and great program. Managers are great and understanding. Works are stressful but rewarded. Overall, it's great.
cons: Not so much to mention, only the interview process took very long time. It took forever since you applied, but when the interview is in progress, it moves really quick.

review_title: Great products, good benefits, painful processes.
pros: You get good pay and benefits while working on some amazing products.
cons: The processes are painfully tedious and full of red tape. Making a difference is difficult unless you are outspoken and like visibility, doesn't matter if you don't know what you're talking about.

pros: Great people who want to do their best.
cons: Management makes it difficult to get anything done.  They are currently laying off a lot of people so they can move the jobs across the country and hire unqualified people at bargain prices.

pros: Good benefits and reputation. Some projects are interesting. Lots of opportunities if you are willing to move around. Relatively stable.
cons: Too many red tapes. Bureaucracy. Very slow on any decision making. Hard to find the right people and get the job done.

pros: Boeing provides good pay and benefits. In my experience, employees generally can get good specialized experience if you want to focus on specific technologies or service roles.
cons: Not always the best place to be if you are looking for a breadth of experience or to be on the cutting edge of newer technologies.

pros: Excellent benefits and high pay job with tons of room to move. Outside of Seattle so no traffic.
cons: People tend to loose their knowledge when they work here and it can become difficult to find job outside. Many of Boeing jobs are not applicable outside of aerospace industry.

job_title: Flight Test Engineer in Seattle, WA
pros:
Work on the major aircraft being developed and flown today.
Reasonable job security.
Good benefits and pay.
cons:
Large company politics and processes
Organizational inertia always resists change.

job_title: Structural Design Engineer in Seattle, WA
pros: Good Benefits, good raises, and lots of time off. Good work life balance.
cons: Routine job, you don't get exposed to much other than your job. Doesn't prepare you well for future jobs.

job_title: Senior Finance Manager in Renton, WA
pros: Supporting a tangible business that you see in the news everyday is rewarding.  Very strong functional performance and skill.  Relatively low turnover.
cons: Narrow definition of roles.  Cyclical its and business environment can impact portion opportunities, regardless of strong performance.  Culture may not be for people that thrive off of uncertainty in responsibilities.

pros: This is my first job post military and couldn't be happier from a company perspective. Good compensation as well as paid overtime due to me being a shift worker. Awesome 401k matching.
cons: Health insurance is bad compared to the military, but I actually hear it is good compared to other civilian companies.

pros: Work-life balance is unbeatable. Management is friendly and benefits (although changing with cost reductions) are competitive.
cons: BSRP positions are not very intellectually challenging. A lot of low-level work for people who just got out of college.

review_title: Love to be busy, morale needs work
job_title: Structural Analysis Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Dedicated people, challenging problems, worldwide exposure, creative outlet, hands-on experience, great benefits, community service involve the opportunities, off-hours learning opportunities.
cons: Poor morale and fear of job security with current layoffs and mass exodus to a competitor. Executive management flows down edicts without accepting feedback.

pros: Boeing has a good work/life balance and great benefits
cons: Boeing corporate does not support it subsidiaries even if they have a legitimate reason for needing financial support

review_title: Opportunity for advancement is limited if you are involved in the union. Boeing is actively anti union.
pros: Steady paycheck.  There is always work to be done.  Benefits are good at present.   Pay is decent also.
cons: Advancement is not based on achievement but on who you are friends with.

review_title: Great company for people just looking to get by
pros: Work life balance is great! Plenty of vacation and sick days.
cons: Big company that has too many processes that bog everything down. Union makes its hard to weed out people that aren't really qualified. Not a good company for eager graduates, its who you know not what you know.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Huntington Beach, CA
pros: Boeing has great managers and executives, competitive pay, a flexible schedule, and great benefits. Its a great company to work for.
cons: The only con is that if you do not work at a location that is growing and/or doing well, its hard to move up, get raises, etc.

pros: Well for starters. I'm working at Boeing! The job and people are great...they do a great job of making sure youre happy in your position
cons: Managers dont really have enough time to talk. Also some functions arent held responsible for their jobs.

review_title: Comfortable and friendly environment, but nothing special if you're not passionate about airplanes.
job_title: Flight Test Engineer in Seattle, WA
pros: Paid overtime, predictable schedule, pleasant work force, very friendly environment, people are passionate about the end product (airplanes), high standard for safety.
cons: The company doesn't value or prioritize creativity; they undervalue high performers, so there is not much invective or reward to going above and beyond.

pros: The work at Boeing was awesome.  They had some of the best people to work with.  The job was always challenging, interesting and it was a learning environment
cons: It is a big corporation that can move slow at times.

review_title: Not a great company for high achieving millennial
pros: Work-life balance, low expectations for the most part (makes up a little bit of the con)
cons: If you want are a high achieving and hard working millennial don't expect to be rewarded fairly. In Boeing's eyes, all millennials are created equal and all should get minimum pay.

review_title: Good benefits and work life balance. But be prepared to move slow
job_title: Senior Electrical Engineer in El Segundo, CA
pros: Lots of good work. They have an expert on site for almost anything, so there is a lot to learn. Good work life balance.
cons: Moves slow. Hard to push change sometimes. Like any large company, you have to push hard for raises and more responsibility.

review_title: Big company with big company problems
pros: Educational benefits, opportunities to move around
cons: Benefits are reduced year over year, culture suffers when the focus is solely the bottom line, work in fear of loosing job

pros: The best company to work for. They offer great work spaces, benefits and working up within the company
cons: Travel expense accounting is not good.

job_title: Finance Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great benefits, amazing products & services, ability to rotate around across multiple programs, functions and sites worldwide.
cons:
If you're not Engineering, you're not important and completely replaceable.
Hard work will get you more hard work. Promotions are rare and based upon who you know and not work performance.

pros: Employee Assistance Programme, Employee focused, great development opportunities, made me feel like I was family. Ethical, diversity, respected, and enterprising.
cons: Some aspects were overburdened with big business attitude.

job_title: Software Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Engaging and very rewarding job
cons: No cons that I can think of

review_title: Overall good company, but some flaws
job_title: Customer Program Manager in Tukwila, WA
pros: Great health benefits, great school benefits, paid for my grad school.
cons: Old school mentality, needs to get with the times and allow employees more work from home options.  Hard to fire lazy employees. Good employees go elsewhere.

review_title: Overall good company, but some flaws
job_title: Customer Program Manager in Tukwila, WA
pros: Great health benefits, great school benefits, paid for my grad school.
cons: Old school mentality, needs to get with the times and allow employees more work from home options.  Hard to fire lazy employees. Good employees go elsewhere.

review_title: Great place to work with great benefits!
job_title: Quality Assurance Engineer in Long Beach, CA
pros: Continually looking for way to improve products,  processes and systems.
cons: Big bureaucratic company that's not so agile.  Lots of leaders moving around.

review_title: Great company with great growth opportunities
pros: Great growth opportunities, Best in class salary packages. Pure technical company a delight to engineers, great work life balance,
cons: No cons the company is doing phenomenally well in Bangalore

pros: Got to work on a lot of big projects right off the bat on a development program.
cons: Don't get to do as much actual engineering as I'd like, more project management. Upper management doesn't seem to have career growth or interests in mind. Seat time is much more important than actual job skill in regards to advancement/promotions.

review_title: They will throw you out and replace you your just a #
pros: Great pay and benefits
cons: Your just a number to them and the union was absolutely zero help because they are in bed with the company. Sad

job_title: Production Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good money, and good people trying to do the right thing.
cons: Union has management by the short hairs - get away with anything. Leadership is completely out of touch with reality. Deadlines drive production - NO MATTER WHAT DELIVER ON TIME.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist  in Seattle, WA
pros: They pay for schooling and the benefits are like no other.
cons: Huge company.  Sometimes you can get "lost" from view if you transfer between business units.

review_title: Boeing is a great place to work - just needs to make software salaries more competitive
job_title: Software Engineer III  in Seattle, WA
pros: The job stability in the software field, flexible work shedule, and benefits package.
cons: Promotion opportunities and salaries are both lacking compared to other large companies in the Seattle area.

pros: I get to specialize and become a true expert in a given area, Boeing Co. Is very supportive in ensuring eveyone is properly trained.
cons: I do not get to be involved in a project from inception to full product.  Also, I am only involved in a small specilized area of the whole process.

pros: Great benefits package.  Fair place to work with supportive work environment.
cons: Work life balance is talked about a lot... but not taken as seriously as it could.  500+ hours of OT a year wears on ya.

pros: Good pay if you are willing to fight for it. Chance to move up.
cons: You have to fight for everything. Management is sub-par. It can feel like a good old boy network. Boeings vision of diversity in leadership is white women. Lacking a diverse culture.

review_title: If you like fast-paced micro management than you have come to the right place
pros: Job Security, Low Cost Health Insurance, Global company name, mobility to move positions, and your team.
cons: Charts and Powerpoints, lack of streamline approvals, inconsistent messaging, and lower pay than the industry.

pros: “Overall great experience and one of the best aeronautics & aerospace providers to work for. Would definitely recommend to a friend. Overall, I think they have the 'Best Equipped Manufacturing Facilities'. They offer many Career and Educational Opportunities to pursue, and sponsor tuition as an incentive."
cons: None, come to mind at the moment.

pros: - Very cool product to work on.  Team members truly care about the work they do and the end user.
cons: Many people stay in the career for a long time, so it is hard to get new ideas through or change the way of business.

job_title: Applications Developer in Long Beach, CA
pros: Relaxed environment, but Boeing is moving out of California. Constantly changing first level managers to the point where you can be working for someone who lives in a different state and really has little involvement with you work.
cons: Upper management cannot be trusted. Changes to benefits packages are never positive for the affected employees.

review_title: Boeing is a company in transition and is starting to acknowledge the need to pay for performance
pros: Definitely the opportunity to grow quickly and have a high level of exposure if you work on the right projects
cons: Bureaucracy and focus on "years of experience"

pros: Security badge/card needed to enter the building to keep un-screened non-employees out.
cons: Be aware of some of the other employees. Some fist fights have occured in the Boeing Travel department.

pros: Great salary and a chance to work on interesting projects using leading edge technologies. Opportunities to travel and meet people from different divisions.
cons: Away from Seattle and other large centres career opportunities can be limited. Stress of working on a large project that is constantly behind on all KPIs.

review_title: Boeing is a good place to explore your career potential. Extensive support are available for sound engineering judgement
job_title: Liasison Engineer in Ridley Park, PA
pros: Multiple products interrelated and technologically advanced
cons: Depends mostly on government contracts and business need are heavily dependent on federal spending.

pros:
-Encourage movement within the organization.
-Standard annual raises and bonus.
-Strong earnings and steady work
cons: There are a lot of moving parts with a company of this size.  Unfortunately, with the ease to move between roles in the company, departments are rarely full staffed and have fully trained teams.

pros: If you can get one of the interesting jobs then you will be going to Disneyland everyday!
cons: Making charts for the unnecessary meetings. However, they do pay you the same to do the boring stuff as they do for the fun activities.

review_title: A Challenge - but worth it if you are mentally geared for it
pros: Company appreciates the employees by providing a Bonus vs other companies give you a token or zero
cons: The site is not a full Boeing integrated facility, benefits and otherwise.

pros: Great for minimal skill set. Excellent benifits and tons of room for career growth if you want it.

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Chicago, IL
pros: Flexible work schedule, professional development opportunities, tuition assistance, and outstanding products to be proud of.
cons: Length of the hiring process (both internal and external hiring).

review_title: Only if you got Thick Skin
pros: the money is ok, and the bonuses are ok if you get one. that's it
cons: not for someone who likes to feel part of a team, management is terrible and gossips just as bad as the rest of the employees, alot of old timers stand around and talk all day and don't work while you the newbie work your butt off. people are rude and don't make eye contact

review_title: Overall great job but lacking the entrepreneurial spirit
job_title: Procurement Agent II in Everett, WA
pros: Education incentive is top notch. Random appreciation gifts, health, commuter and retirement benefits are all positives. The people are great.
cons: Promotions are based on seniority , leadership is old school and resistant to change unless its getting rid of benefits,

pros: Good vacation plan, Two weeks PTO over Christmas/ New Years. Annual bonus (usually about 2 weeks pay).
cons: Poor pay. No upwards mobility. Tendency to lay off employees and either off shore the work, or rehire at a cheaper site. Good old boy system.

job_title: Human Resources Staffing in Renton, WA
pros: Great benefits, competitive compensation, team environment, work-life balance, career/educational development, & management.
cons:
Compensation growth/promotion opportunities can be a bit more competitive. 

Old school way of doing things and mentality. 

Change management principles hard to implement.

pros:
- Amazing products
- Competitive pay
- Vast resources in expertise and equipment
cons:

- Limited "hands on" opportunities
- Tendency to stick people in narrower roles, not built for wearing lots of "hats"

review_title: Boeing BDS Supply Chain Management Internship Program
job_title: Supply Chain Management Intern in Huntington Beach, CA
pros:
- Give interns benefits 
- They like tenure so they are pretty open about wanting you to come back as a full-time
- Hold intern only events often
cons:
- Culturally, a majority of Boeing employees are Generation X

review_title: Boeing BDS Supply Chain Management Internship Program
job_title: Supply Chain Management Intern in Huntington Beach, CA

- Give interns benefits

- Culturally, a majority of Boeing employees are Generation X

pros: Lots of job opportunity, professional development opps, lots of really smart people, decent flexibility and perks, interesting to see the manufacturing process in person
cons: Can be somewhat unstable, so big it can be difficult to network, lots of competition due to the number of qualified people, sprawling campuses, at times difficult  commute

pros: Generous compensation package with generous tuition benefits.
cons: Overly concerned with procedure at the expense of efficiency or common sense. This is an engineering company and if you are in a supporting role your career growth is limited as there are only so many leadership support roles.

pros: Benefits are good and competetive, flexible work hours if not in manufacturing, get to work with some people that really are top talents in their field
cons: Too many people just skating by, in the engineering ranks its hard to make a name for yourself if you dont have 20+ years at the company

job_title: Structural Analysis Engineer II in Washington, DC
pros: Security; great benefits; pride in the products we make; ability for an individual to do many different jobs and pivot careers within the same company
cons: Large company culture stifles culture change and slow to innovate; mediocre promotion potential; currently facing a downturn and behind peers in many ways so shrinking benefits & opportunities

pros: Large corporations provide opportunities for growth and flexibility to try different roles; great education programs; opportunities for professional and personal growth.
cons: Bureaucratic and siloed environment; company is process-oriented but many processes are broken or not followed due to lack of training/knowledge.  Company does not embrace change; culture is not open/transparent enough.

pros: Very easy to change jobs and career focus without leaving the company or region.  Learning and questioning why is supported and celebrated
cons: Big slow moving ship.  Change of any kind is very difficult from getting consensus to change to implementing and not backsliding

pros: The chance to work on a product that impacts millions of lives; large opportunities to develop cross-functional team skills
cons: Antiquated business practices within the manufacturing engineering community; hierarchy is highly emphasized when assigning statement of work

job_title: Quality Assurance Inspector in Renton, WA
pros: Pay and co-workers arts both huge pluses. So many opportunities to advance yourself educationally.
cons: Management is horrible. Life is at work. There is no life once your employed here. You muss your kids growing up and most relationships don't make it.

pros: Great job security and predictability. The union secures predictable raises and bonuses. Generous vacation and sick leave.
cons: Limited opportunity to stand out for individual performance. Raises and bonuses are mostly determined by the company's overall performance.

pros: They keep you busy from day one and are very helpful when it comes to questions. Most people throughout the factory are willing to help you.
cons: If you don't know much about planes, it will be a little overwhelming and a 3 month internship seems like too little time to get to know the company.

job_title: Most of the Company IS Close to Retirement in Everett, WA
pros: Stable job due to the union.
cons: Most of the company is close to retirement. This is tough for young, new hires, since people have often worked in the same job for years and years and look down on people just starting out. The software technology Boeing uses and develops is extremely old and outdated.

pros: Very competitive pay, good benefits, great work-life balance, employees who truly care about doing their jobs, ,management leaves you alone and lets you perform your job
cons: job security seems to be an issue as of late and employees are being laid off, benefits have been noticeably decreasing over the years but are still above average

job_title: 787 Aviation Maintenance Technician in Everett, WA
pros: Boeing provides Healthcare with an empasis on preventative maintenance, has retirement benefits on par with other big companies, you get to work on state of the art aircraft.
cons: I find one of the cons is the union, always put hate and discontent out there. Do i work for Boeing or the IAM.

pros: Good benefits including medical, dental, life insurance with minimal premiums and co-pays.
cons: Uncertainty about your future with constant optimization and layoffs.  Employees don't feel that management really cares about them anymore.

job_title: Project Management Specialist in Mount Pleasant, SC
pros: Great employer.  Provides many opportunities to advance your career (advancement and education opportunities).
cons: None that I can identify.

pros: The people I work with are top notch - friendly, professional, helpful, hard working.
cons: People have been dealing with the threat of being laid off for a long time.  It gets old.  Fortunately, lower level managers do a good job of shielding everyone else from these, and other threats, quite well.

review_title: If it ain't Boeing, I ain't going!
job_title: Senior Quality Engineer in Everett, WA
pros: Value added tasks. I feel like I'm making a positive impact at work. Great 401k matching and health benefits.
cons: Can get insanely busy when you're in a new program. Say goodbye to your work life balance. Stressful times when company is looking to shrink workforce.

pros: Great benefits and opportunities to move around to try different jobs
cons: Can get pigeon-holed in some areas and be stuck performing the same work all the time.

job_title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer in Columbia, MD
pros: Boeing support is happy, professional, and personal! Benefits are better than expected and very clear. PTO provided was perfect without negotiations. It demonstrates respect to their employers and it is throughout the entire Boeing family.
cons: I don't have any cons. The company shares and celebrates their employees hard work everyday in the newa.

job_title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer in Columbia, MD
pros: Boeing support is happy, professional, and personal! Benefits are better than expected and very clear. PTO provided was perfect without negotiations. It demonstrates respect to their employers and it is throughout the entire Boeing family.
cons: I don't have any cons. The company shares and celebrates their employees hard work everyday in the newa.

pros: 401k and PTO benefits are the only pro worth mentioning anymore.  Even these can be subjective since Boeing likes to change policies without any consideration for employees.
cons: Never worked for a company with such awful management.  Moral is continuing to spiral downward seemingly without any concern.  People constantly complain about the poor work environment without anything getting resolved.  The imminent layoffs without proper communication and management and HR refuse to answer questions or they'll just lie straight to your face.

review_title: Boeing is a good company to work for.
job_title: Quality Engineer III in El Paso, TX
pros: Boeing provides a competitive salary and good benefits. I also enjoying working in defense. Knowing we build aircraft to protect our country.
cons: Management does not focus on things that could improve our efficiency, instead they focus on other things that are a waste of time.

pros: Great benefits, fairly compensated,  opportunity to further education and career.
cons: High stress and fast paced, no work life balance, leadership issues.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ridley Park, PA
pros: Lots of room for development accross the enterprise, outstanding benefits and training programs. Good culture overall.
cons: Really hard company to get into, hiring process is very slow, compensation is average accross the industry and can be a bit old school depending on the specific program and customer you work with

pros:
* Interesting work with broad technical base of products
* Ability to move into another domain or interest area
cons:
* Continual cuts to benefits offerings
* Restructuring moves out of Puget Sound

pros:
great pay
great benefits
paid time off
lots of overtime
union
hourly employees are normally pretty cool
you get to work on airplanes!
cons:
union
lots of overtime
management is terrible
limited shift preferences
there's a significant glass ceiling from hourly to salary positions.  hourly employees are rarely able to get promotions and switch to the other side, as the company frequently does external hiring.

pros: Because boeing have more hydraulic system except 787 , and i am from mechanical stream in AME, SO from my point of view it is better for mechanical student.
cons: Most Modern aircraft have operated electically and electonically , so if electonic system improve, it is better for knowledge to mechanical student.

review_title: Overall, it has been an oppurtunity to advance my skills and was the next goal in my career path.
job_title: Technical Publications Writer in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: Boeing has very flexible work hours, vacation, and sick time.  Also, love the 401k.
cons: It has been difficult at times finding the information I need to complete work.

review_title: Get exposed to interesting engineering problems
pros: Many great engineers, with lots of interesting problems that you can work on.  Can have high degree of autonomy depending on supervising manager.
cons: Poorly executed performance management. High degree of variation between managers.  Approximately 10% of workforce is disengaged.

pros: Potential for as much overtime as you're interested in.
cons: Unethical handling of all sexual harassment incidents. The accusers are often moved or silenced by intentional isolation and the individuals who offend suffer zero consequences. Boeing security advises the victims to pursue obtaining court mandated protection orders for further action because Corporate HR will protect the accused employee if they're favored by management despite being presented with evidence and provided self admittance from the offender.

pros: Good work/life balance, and slow paced if that's what you're looking for.
cons: Happiness and level of challenge is greatly dependent on your job role and your manager. Most employees are just lifetime Boeing employees looking to cruise and collect a paycheck. Low motivation and low accountability.

pros: I enjoyed learning on every position I held at the Boeing Company.
cons: Take the opportunity to be a mentor. In addition,  and when you are ready to step up and return jest and help mentor someone else.

job_title: Facilities Project Manager in Everett, WA
pros: Decent pay and benefits however they’ve declined significantly in the past 10 plus years due to Boeing’s continuous cost cutting
cons: Cost cutting has ruined this company and all decisions are made based on its impact to stock price. The culture needs to change.

pros: The people you work with are easily the biggest pro on the job. They are usually very capable and if there is any confusion, people tend to carefully explain solutions to problems.
cons: Pay could be higher to start with.

job_title: Systems Engineer in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The benefits are among the best especially for the defense industry. 401k is also highly rated and matching. Paid overtime. 12 weeks of paid parental leave. Company listens to employee feedback. Career growth opportunities at the site.
cons: Your perceived level of busyness is based off of how much overtime you work.

job_title: IT Analyst Developer in Seal Beach, CA
pros: Benefits, flexible schedule, ability to leverage company resources, bigger campuses have basketball court and gym
cons:
- company culture: slow, no sense of urgency, each site operates differently, boring 
- management: disconnected, not motivational, no direction
- lack of communication between management

review_title: Boeing is old school stereotypical manufacturing environment.
pros: benefits are very good, education reimbursement is very generous.  Opportunities to move within different parts of the company.
cons: So much politics and burocracy that it's difficult to implement change or create efficiencies

job_title: Systems Administrator IV in Tucson, AZ
pros: Good company to work for with good benefits.  Salaries seem above average for similar positions.
cons: Be prepared to relocate if you want a long term job with this employer.  Programs frequently come and go and you may need to move in order to maintain your employment with Boeing.

review_title: Great People, Great Place to work
pros: The opportunities to learn new things and expand anyone's technical abilities are limitless.   Lots of opportunities to advance to new roles or even cross functional roles.
cons: Some times because of the size of the company politics can slow things down.  Employee's need to be creative.

review_title: A decent place to work, when there is work.
job_title: Software Engineer III in Kent, WA
pros: Great programs on the defense side of the company, very easy to move between programs and learn new things.
cons: Lack of future contracts makes it difficult to stay gainfully employed. The total compensation package is much less than in the public sector.

pros: I feel the company has greatly advanced my people skills and building working relationships from a different culture perspective.
cons: Too slow for change, too many bottleneck processes, not enough room for advancement and incompetent management.

pros: Nice place to work if you like working like a drone, attending lots of non-value added meetings, and with little appreciation for well-done work.
cons: High turnover and too many unqualified managers burden existing staff, in a highly bureaucratic, highly political, low productivity work environment.  Few opportunities for promotion.  Excessive re-orgs by managers.  Poorly trained Inexperienced, poorly trained managers.

job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Huntington Beach, CA
pros:
very engaging workplace and opportunities are bountiful
Collaborative
Managers get inputs from employees
Opportunities to move up
cons:
Not very much at the moment but if I had to 
More relocation opportunties should be available
More knowledge transfer between senior and junior engineers
Flexible lab times and schedule

review_title: Best stable job with a long term future
pros: Pays for additional degrees at every level. Good benefits. Challenging. Rewarding. In it for the long term. Lots of little perks.
cons: average salary. slow to move up in salary. Takes a long time to move up. No pension. Low bonuses.

pros: Great learning environment, with an assortment of backgrounds, knowledge and experiences.  Company is constantly adjusting itself to meet challenges.  Employees are mostly professional.
cons: The "Pro" may also become the "Con, as conflicts may exist due to the level of variability.

review_title: Boeing has great benefits, but the culture is very old and slow pace.
job_title: Tool Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The company has great benefits and it is very easy to move around the company.
cons: The company has slow growth. You need to be in the company at least 3 years before you can see any type of real promotion as an engineer

pros: Work was challenging, learned alot from the programs
cons: You must always be on a program that can charge to a customer.   If you do not you're not going to last long as an engineer there unless it's IRAD.   Pay does not compare well with high tech companies.

review_title: Don't put all your eggs in this basket.
job_title: Avionics Technician in San Antonio, TX
pros: Great pay, great tool control program, great hours, great project managers.
cons: Get laid off a lot.

pros: Boeing gives great relocation packages.  They also have great networking opportunities and the ability to tour most of the plans in Puget Sound.
cons: Boeing does not have a large amount of young people working there.  If you are right out of college you will be one of few.

job_title: Business and Planning Analyst in Seattle, WA

cons: Age demographics of the company is pretty skewed, with the majority of the workers being 40+. With budget restrictions, not too much promotions/bonuses are given to younger employees.

cons: You have to take advantage of all the benefits in order to capture the full value of your employment.

pros: Love airplanes is what guides me to do my best. It provides the energy to get me out of bed and give my very best.
cons: The  decision  to work as a direct hire or employee or to keep doing my best as a contractor. Not to be able to get the benefits.

pros: Unique product, good people, lots of opportunities for personal and professional growth.

pros: A lot of opportunities to try different things, and work with people who are really passionate about what they are doing. Good pay, lots of interesting intern events.
cons: A bit slow-paced at times, suffers from a lot of bureaucracy, didn't like the culture of so many webex meetings instead of face-to-face

job_title: Supply Chain Manager in El Segundo, CA

cons: Bureaucratic.  Lots of worthless processes that goes nowhere. Top down culture.  Worthless Union.  Bad cafeteria. Nothing like Google.  Long hrs at time.

pros: Large base of employees with equally large base of open jobs.  Pays well and has relatively good compensation options.
cons: Tends to layoff people that are approaching their retirement age and/or if their health screening indicates potential future health issues.

pros:

pros: Most people are great to work with. Lot's of older engineers with lot's of experience willing to mentor.

pros: Consistant and reliable job. This is a place where job security can me be maintained though good performance.

review_title: Overall, an enriching experience. However, a lot of conflicting processes that affect efficiency of the business.

Perception means more than actual performance

pros: Airplanes, Health Plan, The People

pros: The Boeing Company has a diverse number of positions, and are doing pretty cool stuff on the commercial and defense side, there is plenty of opportunity for upward movement, and travel.

pros: Basic Benefits are hard to beat. The token cost of living adjustments have not kept pace with inflation for the past 10 years.

review_title: Not bad if you aren't looking to move forward

pros: Good work life balance since you are only expected to work 40 hours a week and good benefits including a stellar education program.

Doing good for skilling India.

Senior managers coming from small level industries and spreading across the same work culture.

review_title: Good place to work if you can go around the bad

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Antonio, TX

Large company with countless job opportunities in almost any location

Upper management politics

review_title: Do whatever you can and then get out.

Decent salary
401K

401K with matching benefits
A retirement plan

Management is an old-boy network that has been around for 25 years.

pros: These are some of the greatest products in the world, and to be a part of this team is very rewarding.

review_title: Plenty of opportunities,  but it seems management is disconnected with employee needs

pros: The benefits are fantastic.  They are technologically superior to most other companies out there.  Their "One Boeing" approach is a positive move for the company as a whole.

review_title: Employees are not our greatest asset.

review_title: Advancement  policies outdated in current economic era

pros: Big company, good benefits, finger on innovations in tech. Good bonuses, internal hiring.  Good people for the most part and values diversity

job_title: Embedded Software Engineer in Houston, TX

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Springfield, VA

Despite they do ethical training every year (imposed by the Federal Government that caught them cheating, not by choice) it is just a facade. HR is non-existing, if a manager is acting unethically and you report him to HR, they will tell you to find another job, managers can do whatever they want and they cannot be fired.

review_title: Not a good place for software engineers
job_title: Software Engineer III in Kent, WA
pros: good benefits, smart people (maybe not so much in management), interesting work
cons: years behind in software technology, no interest in automation or tools, repeats the same mistakes, checkbox management, management tends to not be technical and is frequently clueless - which explains most of the cons

job_title: Procurement Agent I in Seattle, WA
pros: Great pay and great experience. Learn every facet of supply chain management. Company is very welcoming and you learn a lot of things.
cons: There were no cons of working for Boeing. It's a great place to work. Plus the locations are wonderful. I really liked it there. I really liked it.

job_title: Systems Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: It's a great company to work for with amazing benefits (which include satisfaction knowing that you contributed to a product) with very talented and smart individuals.

job_title: Financial Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great vacation, career can be what you make it, promotions are good initially, prior experience is a plus
cons: Culture is different depending on what area you work in, hart to get promoted once you get to mid-career, most opportunities are in Seattle

job_title: Business and Planning Analyst in Chicago, IL

cons: No matter how "developed" you feel you are growth is still very slow for most.

pros:
1. Tuition assistance 
2. Managers who know there job and expectations of employees and help them get up to speed
3. Very good processes and procedures established
cons: 1. Political so political if you are not in the circle hard to advance upward

pros: pay and benefits,but pension is going
cons: mgmnt always changing new in out with the old, the new guys try to change the processes which do not work, and guess what....we go back to how we did it!

job_title: Business Finance Analyst in Oakton, VA
pros: Boeing is a big company.  Offers great benefits.  Advancement potential unlimited as long as you get in with the right people.  Work Life balance is ok - some managers are more flexible than others.
cons: Constantly reorganizing and sometimes slow to make changes.  Old school management mentality.

review_title: The work is good, but never turned great company into a mediocre managed one.
job_title: Applied Mathematician IV in Renton, WA
pros: Incredible products,some good managers and a lot of bad ones. I really get to push technology boundaries.
cons: No one running the corporate side has the foggiest clue how to design and build airplanes

job_title: Design and Analysis Engineer I in Everett, WA
pros: Coworkers and environment are great. Good benefits and small perks like a gift card for walking xxx amount for x months
cons: Too large, very slow to get anything done with so many levels of management. Can get disorganized and boring at times

job_title: Financial Analyst in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great work life balance, excellent health insurance, and above average pay. In addition, they have excellent tuition reimbursement for masters programs. The company takes care of its employees
cons: Boeing tends to move a little slower across the company due to its size and older processes. It is easy to get complacent.

pros: Boeing is a global company where employees can wear many hats as a form of employee development.
cons: A lot of jobs are moving out of California.

pros:
Great Benefits
Great Pay - $22.60 as an intern
Great Culture
The work life balance is really good. You work 40 hours and that's it
cons: Don't work here if you want to move up the ladder quickly or if you want to have an ambitious career.

pros: No positives to be mentioned.
cons: No training for first year. Mentor did not care along with Manager.  Very poor communication even within a team.  Too many Mangers made getting anything done very difficult. They pushed cost savings but would not recognize that many people did not have enough work to do.  People took advantage of being a large company.  Sometimes it was a wonder that airplanes were ever built.

pros: Great Benefits and Pay compensation
cons: Its hard to care for each individual employee because its such a big corporation so sometimes it seems to not be in the best interest of your personal situation.

pros: Boeing offers everyone the opportunity to make a difference and to have meaning in the world.  The company is fair and basically you get back what you put in plus some.
cons: No "CONS" that I can share. They offer the opportunity to build yourself and the opportunity to build the company.

job_title: Manager Standards in New York, NY
pros: Flexible and rewarding.  Good employees to work with. Company is stable and growing. Lots of good contacts made within the industry.
cons: I can't think of any.  Commute overseas to keep in touch with contacts gets tiring but rewarding. Jetlag from overseas travel as well as time zone travel is tiring

job_title: Senior Principal Systems Engineer in Huntington Beach, CA
pros: This is primarily a mechanical engineering company.
cons: This company lacks does not do well in the defense industry.  There is a lack of integrity due to the continued focus on marketing with an emphasis on winning contracts through politics.

review_title: I've heard this place is amazing.
pros: Here, you will make good money, great benefits, and more than paper airplanes.  Give it a shot.  You will be glad you did.
cons: The only thing that I can think of would be the hours.  You could be working any various shift, at any hour.

job_title: Manufacturing Engineer in El Segundo, CA
pros: Boeing has tremendous internal resources for learning, management preparation, networking and opportunities for transfer.  A lot of stress on business ethics and diversity.  And of course great products and technology.
cons: Business can cycle wildly, so you need to keep your eye on trends and forecasts.

job_title: Versatile Technologist in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Good salary and benefits, enjoyable work, changing environment, excellent educational opportunities, opportunities to advance provided you are willing to relocate
cons: Don't have long-term job stability due to aerospace contractual obligations, down-sizing is common, if you don't want to relocate then opportunities can be limited

pros: Great benefits; good culture; work with some of the smartest people on the planet; mostly a culture of recognizing and rewarding good work
cons: little internal leadership structure stability; development focus is on leadership, not other career development; little opportunity to attain leadership positions.

review_title: Great for engineers but not so much for others
pros: Great benefits and global company with wide variety of opportunities for engineers.
cons: Outlook for Advancement in other organizations outside of engineering is not so positive.

job_title: HRIS Specialist/Human Resources Service Center Coordinator in Charleston, SC
pros: Great benefits as far as medical, vision and dental.  They have a great 401 (k) plan as well as time off benefits
cons: No real work/life balance.  Management seems to only care about building airplanes

review_title: Not as innovative as you would expect
pros: Good people, interesting projects, above average benefits.
cons: Incredibly bureaucratic, exceedingly slow to make progressive changes, does not actively invest in innovation, and large layoffs have become a regular and expected part of the corporate culture.  Hard to recommend for anyone under 40.

job_title: Procurement Financial Analyst III in Bothell, WA
pros: Boeing has a good work life balance. Good benefits, including a great education assistance program. Some room to move around within the company.
cons: Pay is so-so. Business practices are frozen in time. Too many layers of management. Some of the cultural norms resist change.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in El Segundo, CA
pros: Challenging work and highly technical team
cons: low salary compared to industry / ups and downs of the market are not well managed

pros: Decent wage, good benefits, great people
cons: No communication, High school feel of gossip and more management skills.  Employees are easily discarded to make room for their Billion dollar profit. Layoffs are rampant and constant. A company to not invest to much time into.

review_title: Interesting and challenging but you’ll never get rich
pros: Fascinating work at times, you could find yourself working with any technology from old to cutting edge, top-level benefits
cons: Ineffectual upper management, poor job security, any benefits you have may be taken away at a moment’s notice, pay only about 80% of industry average

job_title: Senior Procurement Agent in Everett, WA

pros: Interesting job with occasional travel. Multiple shifts to work on, Management can work with you to provide some flexibility.

pros: Good place to work. Great benefits and good work life balance. Many locations so you can work anywhere.

pros:
Professional Organisation
Good working environment
38 hrs working week
Employee incentives bonus payment
Morning teas to celebrate special events

Variety of opportunity

Feels like 90% are male (white mostly) and all the female are in HR, PA or Accountant/Finance.

review_title: Better benefits than most of the aerospace industry, but maybe not much longer...

pros: 401K benefits, proximity to my house.

pros: Plenty of opportunity to advance. Extremely fair salary. Excellent benefits. A company that understands and can assist a team member with anything.

pros: Job opportunities are great. A Staff Analyst responsibilities range from an Office Assistant to a true Staff Analyst.

pros: Great benefits, 401K matching, education reimbursement, opportunities to learn and expand knowledge base.

review_title: Best company I've ever worked for!

Do not apply for a job there unless you are a aircraft electrical engineer or a avionics engineer.
